title: Malaysian investor HCK cuts losses with $30m Brisbane office sale
text:
Malaysian investor HCK has exited its disastrous Brisbane office market play after taking a heavy capital loss on its final divestment.

The group sold a 16-level building at 116 Adelaide Street for about $30 million to a local unlisted fund, having paid just under $35 million in 2013.

116 Adelaide Street sold for about $30m, less than what sold for in 2013.

HCK also invested money in refurbishing the near-7000 square metre tower to attract tenants.

Earlier this year, HCK sold a half-empty Brisbane tower at 26 Wharf Street to local investor Renweed Pty Ltd for $9.8 million, as much as $2.45 million below what it paid in 2012.

In between HCK buying and selling the two office buildings, the Brisbane CBD office leasing market has tanked, with vacancy rates rising into the double digits.
description: Malaysian investor HCK has made losses on both Brisbane office towers it purchased six and seven years ago.
